body:
I think this might be fixed once #8406 gets released.

Looks like that `CLANG_CXX_LIBRARY ` difference you noted in the `common.gypi`  file was added in https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/8317.

Electron 1.4.15 included the `common.gypi` from Node 6.5, and Electron 1.5 will be built on Node 7.4 which should have that updated version of `common.gypi`.

Tested this out on master and I was able to compile the add-on using Electron 1.5.

Will leave this open until 1.5.0 hits beta and then will check back in.
@antonycourtney 1.5.0 is out now, can you try building against it?

@kevinsawicki Just downloaded and installed 1.5.0.  Unfortunately I still get the same error, plus a large number of deprecation warnings:

```
$ electron --version
v1.5.0
$ HOME=~/.electron-gyp node-gyp rebuild --target=1.5.0 --arch=x64

In file included from ../hello.cc:1:
In file included from ../node_modules/nan/nan.h:48:
```

@antonycourtney can you building with node `7.4.0` and the following `.npmrc` file?

```
runtime = electron
disturl = https://atom.io/download/electron
target = 1.5.0
arch = x64
```

@kevinsawicki Doesn't seem to make a difference.  When I add that `.npmrc` in the same directory, I get the same result:  `node-gyp rebuild` seems to be build without warnings or errors for node, but `HOME=~/.electron-gyp node-gyp rebuild --target=1.5.0 --arch=x64` fails.

Are you able to clone this repository and reproduce the build error?

@kevinsawicki ...sorry; by 'this repository' I mean [https://github.com/antonycourtney/electron-cpp-addon](https://github.com/antonycourtney/electron-cpp-addon)  Tried to make it absolutely minimal and have clear instructions on how to reproduce the problem.

> Tried to make it absolutely minimal and have clear instructions on how to reproduce the problem.

Yeah, I've cloned this repository locally and with that `.npmrc` file at the root of that repository I am able to build with 1.5.0:

```
$ HOME=~/.electron-gyp npm build .

> hello_world@0.0.0 install /Users/kevin/github/electron-cpp-addon
> node-gyp rebuild

  CXX(target) Release/obj.target/hello/hello.o
  SOLINK_MODULE(target) Release/hello.node
```

I wonder what could be different.

And it does fail for me with 1.4.15:

```
$ HOME=~/.electron-gyp npm build .

> hello_world@0.0.0 install /Users/kevin/github/electron-cpp-addon
> node-gyp rebuild

  CXX(target) Release/obj.target/hello/hello.o
  SOLINK_MODULE(target) Release/hello.node
electron-cpp-addon (master %=)⚡ git fm
Fetching origin
Already up-to-date.
electron-cpp-addon (master %=)⚡ HOME=~/.electron-gyp npm build .

> hello_world@0.0.0 install /Users/kevin/github/electron-cpp-addon
> node-gyp rebuild

  CXX(target) Release/obj.target/hello/hello.o
../hello.cc:2:10: fatal error: 'regex' file not found
#include <regex>
         ^
1 error generated.
make: *** [Release/obj.target/hello/hello.o] Error 1
```

@antonycourtney just to confirm, can you completely remove `~/.electron-gyp` and try again?

The file at https://atom.io/download/electron/v1.5.0/iojs-v1.5.0.tar.gz does seem to have the `CLANG_CXX_LIBRARY` in the `common.gypi` file at the root of that archive.

@kevinsawicki Ah, I see the problem now.  Transcription error on my end.  My repro instructions inadvertently left out the `--dist-url=https://atom.io/download/electron` argument to the `node-gyp` incantation.  So it was falling back to pulling `https://iojs.org/download/release/v1.5.0/iojs-v1.5.0.tar.gz`, which doesn't have the `CLANG_CXX_LIBRARY` definition.

Many mant thanks for your help and patience; sorry for this mistake testing candidate fix.  Feel free to close issue.

> Many mant thanks for your help and patience; sorry for this mistake testing candidate fix. Feel free to close issue.

Thanks for the update, glad to hear things are working now, closing this out 👍
